title: House Armed Services Committee Investigation of USS Liberty Attack

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the ship was attacked by the IDF on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In Appendix IV of his PhD dissertation about the attack on the USS Liberty, A. Jay Cristol includes an article written by ADM Michael Ram, Commander-in-Chief of the Israeli Navy and published in the Naval Reserve Association News September 1992 issue. 

I have attached a copy of that article.

In the article, ADM Ram refers to “an extensive investigation of the House Armed Services Committee of the Ninety-Second Congress, under authority of H.Res. 201, published by the Superintendent of Documents in 1971.”

Under the Freedom of Information Act, I am asking you to provide us with a copy of the investigation referred to by ADM Ram as well as H.Res 201 that authorizes that investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Email correspondence (including file attachments, such as PDFs, images, etc.) from January 1st, 2022 to January 1st, 2024, to and from Catheryn Yashar, Professor of Radiation Medicine and Applied Science (cyashar@ucsd.edu) regarding the Radiation Oncology Case Rate (ROCR) model and the the Radiation Oncology Alternative Payment Model (RO-APM or APM).

Correspondence would include members of the 501(c)(6) organization The American Society for Radiation Oncology (ASTRO) and/or the Society of Chairs of Academic Radiation Oncology Programs (SCAROP) and/or the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) and/or the American College of Radiation Oncology (ACRO). It would also include members of the consulting groups “Wakely” and/or “HMA Consulting” and/or “GenesisCare”. 

Both the ROCR and RO-APM models affect how the entire medical specialty of Radiation Oncology is reimbursed nationwide, and have tremendous impact with significant relevance to the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bill Gagnon
